instruction.value: Administer as bolus dose by direct injection.
Administer by continuous infusion for duration of procedure.
Administer by direct injection, if activated clotting time is less than 225 seconds 5 minutes after the direct IV bolus dose.
Administer by continuous infusion, post PCI.
Administer by continuous infusion. If aPTT luess then 60: Increase dose by 20%. IF aPTT 60 to 90: No Change. IF aPTT greater than 90: Hold infusion 1 hour and restart at 50% prior dose.

additionalnotes.value: PCI. In patients with Creatinine Clearance less than 30 mL/minute, reduce the continuous infusion rate to 1 mg/kg/hour.
Post-PCI. May be administered for 4 to 12 hours following stoppage of 1.75 mg/kg/hour infusion., if needed.
Cardiac Surgery - On Cardiopulmonary Bypass (CBP). Infusion may be stopped approximately 15 minutes prior to end of CBP.
Cardiac Surgery - On cardiopulmonary Bypass (CBP). Restarting or if CBP is not stopped within 20 minutes.
Cardiac Surgery - Off Cardiopulmonary Bypass. If patient must be started on CBP, then follow with infusion at 2.5 mg/kg/hour.
Pre / Post Cardiac Surgery. Bolus dose followed by continuous infusion.
Pre / Post Cardiac Surgery. Bolus dose followed by continuous infusion. Monitor aPTT to maintain desired range of 1.5 to 2.5 times baseline value.
Alternative Anti-thrombotic (AT) in Ventricular Assist Device (VAD) Patients. If GFR is 30 to 60 mL/minute: 0.3 mg/kg/hour. If GFR is less than 30 mL/minute: o.2 mg/kg/hour.
